Package com.valmet.watermark.config

Class JwtSettings

java.lang.Object
com.valmet.watermark.config.JwtSettings
@Configuration @PropertySource("classpath:security-info.properties") @ConfigurationProperties(prefix="security.jwt") public class JwtSettings extends Object
Configuration class for JWT (JSON Web Token) settings.

This class maps properties from the `security-info.properties` file into fields that can be used throughout the application to configure JWT behavior. The properties are prefixed with `security.jwt`.

Usage:

  • Ensure the `security-info.properties` file exists in the classpath.
  • Define JWT-related properties in the file using the `security.jwt` prefix.
  • This class is automatically loaded as a Spring bean for easy injection.

Example Properties in `security-info.properties`: 

 security.jwt.tokenExpirationTime=3600
 security.jwt.tokenIssuer=MyAppIssuer
 security.jwt.refreshTokenExpTime=7200
 security.jwt.header=Authorization
 security.jwt.prefix=Bearer

Fields:

  • tokenExpirationTime: Duration (in seconds) for which the JWT token is valid.
  • tokenIssuer: The issuer of the JWT token.
  • refreshTokenExpTime: Duration (in seconds) for which the refresh token is valid.
  • header: The HTTP header used to pass the JWT token.
  • prefix: Prefix (e.g., "Bearer") added to the token in the HTTP header.

This class is annotated with:

  • Configuration: Marks the class as a source of bean definitions.
  • PropertySource: Specifies the properties file to load (`security-info.properties`).
  • ConfigurationProperties: Maps properties with the prefix `security.jwt` to the fields of this class.
  • Data: Lombok annotation to generate getters, setters, and other utility methods.
Version:
1.0
Author:
BJIT
